intro: Rabdosia gesneroides, commonly known as the purple-flowered rabdosia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square, hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly serrated margin. Its showy, violet to purple flowers are clustered in whorls along the stem, making it a striking ornamental plant. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas or along stream banks.
